item.description:
SET YOUR CLOCKS BACK ONE HOUR SATURDAY NIGHT

Carpooling time = 9:30 AM

Our first beach meetup was such great fun that, by popular demand, we've scheduled another one to Long Beach in York, ME also known as Cape Neddick, ME.

The crossroads of Beach St. & Long Beach Ave (Rte 1A) falls just about in the middle of the beach stretch (yet closer to Nubble Rd). There's plenty of street parking.

From our last meetup we've learned to look up the tides schedule ...
York, ME Tides Table for Nov 2008
Low tide starts at 7:28 am and ends at 1:28 pm
That should give us a couple of hours to work up an appetite.

We'll grab lunch before heading back. Judi suggested Foster's.

Here is a good site for Restaurants in York, ME

I think an outdoor venue would be perfect, something with picnic tables where the puppies could join us. Please don't hesitate to pipe in with other suggestions.

The carpooling worked out great so let's do that again... same place - TIME: 9:30 am.
If the main Massabesic parking lot is open, let's meet there.
If not, there's a baseball parking lot DIRECTLY across from the entrance to the Massabesic parking lot entrance. It flanks the trail path closest to the rotary. This trail is parallel to Candia Rd. I'm pointing this out because there is another Baseball field parking lot a short distance away, further along on Rte 28.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for us ON the beach near the crossroads of Beacon & Long Beach Ave (Rt 1A)

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Beach Day - York, ME Long Sands Beach
